summary: Over the 6‑hour window ambient wind was generally low (mean ≈2.8 m/s) with a brief spike to ~12.4 m/s; electrical output was essentially zero on average with very low scatter and a small positive residual bias. Control surfaces stayed near a high angle (~85°) while the unit showed a persistent orientation offset averaging ~65°, operational-state indicators were non-standard for the entire period, rotor speed was effectively constant while the generator shaft showed modest fluctuation, and temperature averaged about 34°C.
